subject: Re: [junit] junit reports
msgSnippet: Balraj, Outside of JUnit is probably your best bet.  Googling HTML to Word gave me some promising links. David Saff
messageBody:
Balraj,

Outside of JUnit is probably your best bet. Googling "HTML to Word"
gave me some promising links.

David Saff

Balraj Goulikar wrote:

> How to get JUnit reports in a word doc? There are html reports produced
> using the foll:
> <target name="testresults" description="Produce a web report of the test
> results (see unittest )"
> depends="unittests">
> <junitreport todir="${reports.webpages}">
> <fileset dir="${reports.junit}">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> <report format="frames" todir="${reports.webpages}"/>
> </junitreport>
> <echo>Your test results are in the directoty "${reports.junit}"</echo>
> </target>
>
> is there a way to get them as word document reports?
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Balraj
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
